quotes.quote: There are few things so tender as a man's dignity.
A light, tender, sensitive touch is worth a ton of brawn.
The tender Mercy of God has given us one another.
A simple smile, a tender touch, speaks the true language of love.
The happiness of the tender heart is increased by what it can take away from the wretchedness of others.
A tender heart is a wakeful, watchful heart. It watches against sin in the soul, sin in the family, sin in the calling, sin in spiritual duties and performances.
The cure for tender sensibilities is to make more of our objects and less of ourselves.
With the tough mind, there must also be a tender heart.
It is better to have a tender than harden human heart.
Tender are a mother's dreams, But her babe's not what he seems. See him plotting in his mind To grow up some other kind.
Tender expressions of love and affection toward children are as much the responsibility of the father as the mother. Tell your children you love them.
Tender words we spoke to one another are sealed in the secret vaults of heaven. One day like rain, they will fall to earth and grow green all over the world.
There is nothing as strong as tenderness, And nothing as tender as true strength.
Where you are tender, you speak your plural.
Motherhood is at its best when the tender chords of sympathy have been touched.
Love is an act of endless forgiveness, a tender look which becomes a habit.
Fathers need to be tough and tender...you be tough for your family, be tender with your family. You protect them, and you be a safe place.
Our hearts grow tender with childhood memories and love of kindred, and we are better throughout the year for having, in spirit, become a child again at Christmas time.
He who tenders doubtful safety to those in trouble refuses it.
Even the smallest tender mercy can bring peace when recognized and appreciated.
And I have a tender spot in my heart for cripples and bastards and broken things.
Just a tender sense of my own process, that holds something of my connection with the divine.
Her tender feet felt as if cut with sharp knives, but she cared not for it; a sharper pang had pierced through her heart.
No power on earth compares to a mother's tender prayers.
Be patient with yourself. Self-growth is tender; it's holy ground. There's no greater investment.
Love is a tender plant; when properly nourished, it becomes sturdy and enduring, but neglected it will soon wither and die.
True love is deemed to be the most tender of our emotions, as even the blind and deaf know; but I know, what few believe, that true friendship is more tender still.
It is in your self-interest to find a way to be very tender.
If no tender words are spoken, no tender hearts can be broken.
Sometimes you have to avoid mentioning things because people's feelings are tender.
